definition[0]: to officially tell people about something, especially about a plan or a decision
example[0]: They announced their engagement in ‘The Times’.
example[1]: At the end of their meeting, it was announced that an agreement had been reached.
example[2]: The government has announced plans to create 10,000 new jobs.
example[3]: A government spokesman announced that the hostages had been released.
example[4]: Cordon announced his resignation to staff members on Wednesday.
definition[1]: to say something, especially something that other people will not like, in a loud and confident way
example[5]: ‘I’m not going to their party, ’ Maggie announced.
example[6]: He stood up and announced that he was ready to go.
definition[2]: to give information to people using a loudspeaker or microphone, especially at an airport or railway station
example[7]: We arrived just as they were announcing the arrival of Flight 207 from Minneapolis.
definition[3]: to introduce a programme on television or radio
